53d4bb1d-e6a4-41e2-9f66-135b269e932e.description: Powersim Solutions provides a simulated business environment in support of NIB's development of essential business skills. By taking a comprehensive view of the organization's operations, learners understand how decisions and actions impact the business as a whole and work effectively and collaboratively as team members. Earners of the Business Essentials badge have successfully developed and executed a business strategy, analyzed markets, competitors, customers and performance.
53d4bb1d-e6a4-41e2-9f66-135b269e932e.name: Powersim + NIB Certified: Business Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Execsims simulation created by Powersim Solutions in support of NIB Business Essentials. This competitive simulation requires teams to conduct a comprehensive analysis of the business environment, develop and execute strategy and make weekly decisions across functional areas of marketing, sales, R&D, human resources, operations and finance.  Teams play the simulation for five simulated years and review comprehensive reports for all functional areas after each simulation round.
Complete two online courses - Budgeting for Non-Finance Professionals and Problem Solving and Decision Making - that required reading, watching videos and taking a test.

Pass assessment indicating successful completion of course outcomes.  Assessment consists of a written test, successful implementation of strategy, presentations of simulation strategy, simulation performance outcomes and team decision-making processes.

Attend eight scheduled conference calls lasting approximately one hour.  Calls included discussions of results and team decision-making activities. Facilitators also led discussions on selected topics pertaining to marketing, financial analysis, team decision-making and leadership.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Execsims simulation created by Powersim Solutions. This competitive simulation requires teams to conduct a comprehensive analysis of case studies and the business environment, develop and execute strategy and make weekly decisions across functional areas of marketing, sales, R&D, human resources, operations and finance.  Teams play the simulation for six simulated years and review comprehensive reports for all functional areas after each simulation round.

Attend six scheduled conference calls lasting approximately one hour.  Calls included discussions of results and team decision-making activities. Facilitators also led discussions on selected topics pertaining to marketing, financial analysis, team decision-making and leadership.
